data.placeDescription: The most iconic temple complex in Cambodia and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, representing the pinnacle of Khmer architecture.
Famous for its massive stone faces and intricate bas-reliefs, located in the center of Angkor Thom.
A temple left mostly unrestored, with trees growing through the stone structures, creating a mystical jungle atmosphere.
A small but beautifully detailed temple built of pink sandstone, known as the 'Jewel of Khmer Art'.
A stunning island known for crystal-clear waters, coral reefs, and white sand beaches.
A quieter sister island of Koh Rong, perfect for relaxing and enjoying untouched nature.
A mountain park featuring waterfalls, misty views, and historical French colonial buildings.
Renowned pepper farms producing world-famous Kampot pepper, offering guided tours and tastings.
An ancient hilltop temple offering panoramic views of the countryside.
A serene temple complex beside a peaceful lake, popular for picnics and weekend visits.
A large wildlife sanctuary housing rescued animals like tigers, elephants, and bears.
An ancient riverside pagoda located along the Tonle Sap River with beautiful local architecture.
A community of floating houses and boats along the Tonle Sap, showcasing local river life.
A sacred mountain temple with ancient Buddha statues and panoramic countryside views.
Pre-Angkorian temple ruins recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
An ancient Khmer temple hidden in lush greenery, known for its peaceful environment.
A hilltop site with caves, pagodas, and memorials, offering sunset views and a bat cave spectacle.
An 11th-century Angkor-style temple located on a hill with scenic countryside views.
A fun and unique bamboo railway ride through the Cambodian countryside.
A stunning cliff-top temple dedicated to Shiva, offering dramatic views over Thailand and Cambodia.
A remote ancient city featuring a seven-tiered pyramid temple surrounded by jungle.
A sacred mountain with waterfalls, Buddha carvings, and historical significance to the Khmer Empire.
A sacred riverbed with thousands of carvings depicting Hindu deities.
Southeast Asia’s largest freshwater lake, home to floating villages and rich biodiversity.
A scenic area along the Mekong River where visitors can spot rare Irrawaddy dolphins.
A peaceful island in the Mekong River with cycling paths and local homestays.
A conservation project that allows visitors to see rescued elephants in their natural forest habitat.
A majestic multi-tiered waterfall surrounded by jungle and ethnic minority villages.
A cool highland town known for its rolling hills, coffee farms, and eco-tourism lodges.
A beautiful volcanic lake surrounded by rainforest, perfect for swimming and relaxing.
A scenic waterfall hidden within Ratanakiri’s lush forest.
A lively local market selling traditional crafts and local produce.
The official residence of the King of Cambodia, featuring golden pagodas and beautiful gardens.
Houses the world’s largest collection of Khmer art and artifacts.
A historic pagoda on a small hill in the city center, marking the birthplace of Phnom Penh.
Built to commemorate Cambodia’s independence from France in 1953.
A memorial site dedicated to victims of the Khmer Rouge regime.
A former high school turned into a prison during the Khmer Rouge era, now a museum of remembrance.
A small seaside town known for its crab market, quiet beaches, and sunset views.
A small island off Kep’s coast, popular for its laid-back vibe and clear waters.
A seasonal bamboo bridge rebuilt annually by locals to connect to Koh Paen Island.
An ancient hilltop temple overlooking the Mekong River.
Famous for long stretches of sandy beaches and nearby islands.
A peaceful and scenic beach area ideal for swimming and sunsets.
A natural waterfall surrounded by forest, great for a short hike or picnic.
A 6th-century temple built on a small hill, one of Cambodia’s oldest religious sites.
An ancient temple ruin offering breathtaking countryside views.
A peaceful lake surrounded by rice fields, perfect for local-style relaxation.
A unique bridge shaped like a dragon, a popular local photo spot.
A massive Japanese-built bridge spanning the Mekong River, connecting Kandal and Prey Veng.
A former royal capital featuring stupas, Buddha statues, and scenic views.
A lively riverside market selling street food, souvenirs, and clothing.
